What is the purpose of the `getbestblockhash` command in Verus?
The `getbestblockhash` command returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain.

getbestblockhash Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain. Result "hex"   (string) the block hash hex encoded Examples > verus getbestblockhash > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
What is the format of the result returned by the `getbestblockhash` command?
The result returned by the `getbestblockhash` command is a string representing the block hash in hexadecimal encoding.

getbestblockhash Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain. Result "hex"   (string) the block hash hex encoded Examples > verus getbestblockhash > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
How can I use the `getbestblockhash` command in Verus to retrieve the hash of the best block in the longest block chain?

You can use the `getbestblockhash` command in Verus by running the following command: `verus getbestblockhash`

Alternatively, you can also use the JSON-RPC interface to retrieve the best block hash by sending a JSON request to the Verus server. For example:
```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```

getbestblockhash Returns the hash of the best (tip) block in the longest block chain. Result "hex"   (string) the block hash hex encoded Examples > verus getbestblockhash > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getbestblockhash", "params": [] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
